result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Activity:Preliminary hearing/arraignment 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

08:44 AM Defendant Robert Alvin Friedrich in court in person  with attorney Joseph Michael Freier in person.  Emmeline Lee appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.   Defendant stands mute, not guilty plea entered by court, jury trial to be set.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on April 12, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Activity: Indigency hearing 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

1:34 PM Defendant Robert Alvin Friedrich in court in person.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds the defendant indigent and appoints attorney Joseph Freier. Defendant to reimburse County $100 per month.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Indigency hearing on March 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Activity: adjourned initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:03 AM Defendant Robert Alvin Friedrich in court appearing by audio.  David Zarwell   and intern Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant to submit petition for court appointed attorney. Remand to branch 1 for scheduling.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Cannot operate a motor vehicle during pendency of case  at all. Maintain absolute sobriety.

Activity: initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

01:07 PM Defendant Robert Alvin Friedrich in court appearing by audio.  Mason C Braunschweig   and intern Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video  for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Signature bond set of $750.00   with conditions.   Cannot operate a motor vehicle during pendency at all and maintain absolute sobriety. Must sign bond Wednesday, February 16, 2022 between noon and 1pm. Matter continued to allow defendant time to obtain an attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
